title: full effect to Commission Regulation (EU) 2020/ 687 of 17 December 20191 in
heading: 1. (1) These are the Avian Influenza (Temporary Measures) (No. 2)
text_raw:
1. (1) These are the Avian Influenza (Temporary Measures) (No. 2) 

Regulations 2022. 

(2) In 

these Regulations “EU Regulation” means Regulation (EU) 

2020/687 of 17 December 2019. 

(3) A word or expression that is used in the EU Regulation and that is also 
used in these Regulations has, in these Regulations unless the contrary 
intention appears, the same meaning as in the EU Regulation.
text_norm: 1 (1) avian influenza (temporary measures) (no 2) regulation 2022 (2) regulation eu regulation mean regulation (eu) 2020 687 17 december 2019 (3) word expression used eu regulation also used regulation regulation unless contrary intention appears meaning eu regulation

title: full effect to Commission Regulation (EU) 2020/ 687 of 17 December 20191 in
heading: 2. These Regulations, other than Regulations 4 (2), (3) and (4), apply in
text_raw:
2. These Regulations, other than Regulations 4 (2), (3) and (4), apply in 
that part of the State more particularly described in Schedule 1 (“surveillance 
zone”), “and Schedule 2 (“protection zone”).
text_norm: 2 regulation regulation 4 (2) (3) (4) apply part state particularly described schedule 1 ( surveillance zone ) schedule 2 ( protection zone )

title: full effect to Commission Regulation (EU) 2020/ 687 of 17 December 20191 in
heading: 3. Land or premises–
text_raw:
3. Land or premises– 

(a) 

(b) 

that lies partly within the protection zone and partly within the 
surveillance zone is deemed to lie wholly within the protection 
and 

subject to paragraph (a), that lies partly within the surveillance 
zone, partly and partly outside the surveillance zone is deemed 
to lie wholly within the surveillance zone.
text_norm: 3 land premises- (a) (b) lie partly within protection zone partly within surveillance zone deemed lie wholly within protection subject paragraph (a) lie partly within surveillance zone partly partly outside surveillance zone deemed lie wholly within surveillance zone

title: full effect to Commission Regulation (EU) 2020/ 687 of 17 December 20191 in
heading: 4. (1) A person shall not move, or cause or permit another person to move,
text_raw:
4. (1) A person shall not move, or cause or permit another person to move, 
poultry, other captive birds, poultrymeat (subject to Regulation 5), eggs, 
carcasses, feed materials or straw originating on land or premises situate in the 
protection zone or the surveillance zone, poultry litter or poultry manure – 

(a) 

from the land or premises where they are situate, or 

(b) onto land or premises situate within an area described in either 

Schedule 1 or Schedule 2, 

except in accordance with a licence issued by the Minister. 

1 O.J, L 174 of 3.6.2020, 64; http://data.europa.eu/eli/reg_del/2020/687/oj 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 25th November, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [592] 3 

(2) A person shall not have poultry, other captive birds, poultrymeat, eggs, 
carcasses, feed materials or straw originating on land or premises situate in the 
protection zone or the surveillance zone, poultry litter or poultry manure that 
has been moved in contravention of paragraph (1) in his or her possession or 
under his or her control. 

(3) A person shall not spread, or cause or permit another person to spread, 
poultry litter or manure on land except in accordance with a licence issued by 
the Minister. 

(4) A person shall not move poultry, other captive birds or eggs that have 
been moved from land or premises situate within an area described in either 
Schedule 1 or Schedule 2 from the place to which the poultry, other captive 
birds or eggs have been moved (whether the last-mentioned place is within an 
area described in either Schedule 1 or Schedule 2 or otherwise) until a period 
of at least 21 days has elapsed since the arrival of such poultry, other captive 
birds or eggs at that place. 

(5) Paragraphs (1) and (4) do not apply to table eggs moved directly from 

an egg packing centre if- 

(a) 

the table eggs were transported to the egg packing centre in- 

(i) 

single-use disposable packaging, or 

(ii) packaging which has been cleaned and disinfected in a 

manner that kills the avian influenza virus, and 

(b) 

are moved directly to – 

(i) 

an egg product plant approved in accordance with the 
European Communities 
(Food and Feed Hygiene) 
Regulations 2020, 

(ii) 

a premises used for the retail sale or wholesale of eggs.

title: full effect to Commission Regulation (EU) 2020/ 687 of 17 December 20191 in
heading: 5. A person shall not move poultry meat from land or premises used by a
text_raw:
5. A person shall not move poultry meat from land or premises used by a 
food business operator (within the meaning of the European Communities 
(Food and Feed Hygiene) Regulations 2020) as a slaughterhouse, cutting plant 
or cold store unless the poultry meat – 

(a) 

is – 

(i) 

(ii) 

(b) 

is – 

obtained from poultry which originated from premises 
situate outside the protection zone, and 

stored and transported separately from poultry meat 
obtained from poultry which originated from premises 
situate within the protection zone, or 

(i) marked in accordance with Annex IX of Commission 
Delegated Regulation 2020/687 of 17 December 20192, 
and 

2 O.J. L 174 of 3.6.2020, 64; http://data.europa.eu/eli/reg_del/2020/687/oj 

 
 
 
 4 [592] 

(ii) 

intended for sale or supply within the State and is not 
exported.

title: full effect to Commission Regulation (EU) 2020/ 687 of 17 December 20191 in
heading: 6. A person who has poultry or other captive birds in his or her possession
text_raw:
6. A person who has poultry or other captive birds in his or her possession 
or under his or her control or otherwise has knowledge of such poultry or other 
captive birds shall immediately notify an authorised officer at the Regional 
Veterinary Office of the Department of Agriculture, Food and the Marine 
within whose functional area the poultry or other captive birds situate of any 
increased levels of avian influenza, deaths of poultry or other captive birds, or 
significant production drop among poultry or captive birds.
text_norm: 6 person poultry captive bird possession control otherwise knowledge poultry captive bird shall immediately notify authorised officer regional veterinary office department agriculture food marine within whose functional area poultry captive bird situate increased level avian influenza death poultry captive bird significant production drop among poultry captive bird

title: full effect to Commission Regulation (EU) 2020/ 687 of 17 December 20191 in
heading: 7. (1) A person shall not move, or cause or permit another person to move,
text_raw:
7. (1) A person shall not move, or cause or permit another person to move, 
a farm animal, other than poultry or other captive birds, from land or premises 
where poultry or other captive birds are present or cause or permit such an 
animal to be on other land or premises except in accordance with a licence 
issued by the Minister. 

(2) A person shall not cause or permit a farm animal, including poultry or 
other captive birds, to be brought onto land or premises where poultry or other 
captive birds are present or cause or permit such an animal to be on the land or 
premises except in accordance with a licence issued by the Minister.
text_norm: 7 (1) person shall move cause permit another person move farm animal poultry captive bird land premise poultry captive bird present cause permit animal land premise except accordance licence issued minister (2) person shall cause permit farm animal including poultry captive bird brought onto land premise poultry captive bird present cause permit animal land premise except accordance licence issued minister

title: full effect to Commission Regulation (EU) 2020/ 687 of 17 December 20191 in
heading: 8. A person shall not release poultry or other captive birds from the land
text_raw:
8. A person shall not release poultry or other captive birds from the land 
or premises where they are kept or cause or permit such birds to be released or 
stray from that land or premises.
text_norm: 8 person shall release poultry captive bird land premise kept cause permit bird released stray land premise

title: full effect to Commission Regulation (EU) 2020/ 687 of 17 December 20191 in
heading: 9. (1) An application for a licence under these Regulations shall be in a
text_raw:
9. (1) An application for a licence under these Regulations shall be in a 
form, contain such particulars and be made in a manner that the Minister may 
determine. 

(2) The Minister may grant a licence, attach conditions to a licence, vary a 

condition, insert a new condition, withdraw a licence, or refuse an application.
text_norm: 9 (1) application licence regulation shall form contain particular made manner minister may determine (2) minister may grant licence attach condition licence vary condition insert new condition withdraw licence refuse application

title: full effect to Commission Regulation (EU) 2020/ 687 of 17 December 20191 in
heading: 10. (1) A person shall not bring a vehicle onto land or premises where
text_raw:
10. (1) A person shall not bring a vehicle onto land or premises where 
poultry or other captive birds are present unless the vehicle has been cleaned 
and disinfected in a manner that kills the avian influenza virus – 

(a) 

(b) 

prior to coming onto the land or premises, and 

after it has been on other land or premises where poultry or 
other captive birds are present or being in contact with poultry, 
other captive birds, eggs, carcasses, poultry litter or poultry 
manure. 

(2) A person shall not have a vehicle that has been brought onto land or 
premises in contravention of paragraph (1) in his or her possession or under his 
or her control. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [592] 5
text_norm: 10 (1) person shall bring vehicle onto land premise poultry captive bird present unless vehicle cleaned disinfected manner kill avian influenza virus - (a) (b) prior coming onto land premise land premise poultry captive bird present contact poultry captive bird egg carcass poultry litter poultry manure (2) person shall vehicle brought onto land premise contravention paragraph (1) possession control 592 5

title: full effect to Commission Regulation (EU) 2020/ 687 of 17 December 20191 in
heading: 11. A person who has charge of a vehicle, machinery or equipment used in
text_raw:
11. A person who has charge of a vehicle, machinery or equipment used in 
connection with poultry or other captive birds or that has been in contact with 
poultry or other captive birds shall take all necessary steps to ensure that the 
vehicle, machinery or equipment is cleaned and disinfected before and 
immediately after use or contact with poultry, other captive birds or any other 
thing that could be affected by avian influenza virus with in in a manner that 
kills the virus, in accordance with the instructions (if any) of an authorised 
officer.
text_norm: 11 person charge vehicle machinery equipment used connection poultry captive bird contact poultry captive bird shall take necessary step ensure vehicle machinery equipment cleaned disinfected immediately use contact poultry captive bird thing could affected avian influenza virus manner kill virus accordance instruction (if any) authorised officer

title: full effect to Commission Regulation (EU) 2020/ 687 of 17 December 20191 in
heading: 12. A person who has poultry or other captive birds in his or her possession
text_raw:
12. A person who has poultry or other captive birds in his or her possession 
or under his or her control shall take all necessary measures to ensure that all 
animal and carcasses are disposed of as soon as possible in accordance with 
Regulation (EC) No 1069/2009 of the European Parliament and of the Council 
of 21 October 20093.
text_norm: 12 person poultry captive bird possession control shall take necessary measure ensure animal carcass disposed soon possible accordance regulation (ec) 1069 2009 european parliament council 21 october 20093

title: full effect to Commission Regulation (EU) 2020/ 687 of 17 December 20191 in
heading: 13. A person who, on land or premises, has poultry or other captive birds in
text_raw:
13. A person who, on land or premises, has poultry or other captive birds in 
his or her possession or under his or her control shall take all necessary steps to 
ensure that all parts of a vehicle that enters or leaves the land or premises is 
cleaned and disinfected in a manner that kills the avian influenza virus, in 
accordance with the instructions (if any) of an authorised officer.
text_norm: 13 person land premise poultry captive bird possession control shall take necessary step ensure part vehicle enters leaf land premise cleaned disinfected manner kill avian influenza virus accordance instruction (if any) authorised officer

title: full effect to Commission Regulation (EU) 2020/ 687 of 17 December 20191 in
heading: 14. (1) A person in possession or control of land or premises where poultry
text_raw:
14. (1) A person in possession or control of land or premises where poultry 
or other captive birds are present shall maintain a record all persons who enter 
the land or premises and make the record available upon request to an 
authorised officer. 

(2) Paragraph (1) does not apply to persons normally resident there who 
enter a dwelling on the land or premises without having contact with poultry or 
other captive birds, or to a zoo or wildlife park.
text_norm: 14 (1) person possession control land premise poultry captive bird present shall maintain record person enter land premise make record available upon request authorised officer (2) paragraph (1) apply person normally resident enter dwelling land premise without contact poultry captive bird zoo wildlife park

title: full effect to Commission Regulation (EU) 2020/ 687 of 17 December 20191 in
heading: 15. Regulations 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 10, 11, 12, 13 and 14 are penal provisions to
text_raw:
15. Regulations 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 10, 11, 12, 13 and 14 are penal provisions to 

which section 36 (4) (b) of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 applies.
text_norm: 15 regulation 4 5 6 7 8 10 11 12 13 14 penal provision section 36 (4) (b) animal health welfare act 2013 applies

title: full effect to Commission Regulation (EU) 2020/ 687 of 17 December 20191 in
heading: 16. A veterinary practitioner may take a sample from an animal or animal
text_raw:
16. A veterinary practitioner may take a sample from an animal or animal 
product and submit it to a laboratory situate within the State for examination, 
testing or analysis other than for the detection of avian influenza.
text_norm: 16 veterinary practitioner may take sample animal animal product submit laboratory situate within state examination testing analysis detection avian influenza

text_raw:

revoked.

That part of the County of Monaghan) that comprises the townlands of-

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

22 November, 2022. 

CHARLIE MCCONALOGUE, 

Minister for Agriculture, Food and the Marine.

title: full effect to Commission Regulation (EU) 2020/ 687 of 17 December 20191 in
heading: (This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

These Regulations provide for precautionary measures to be taken in 
surveillance and protection zones established in County Monaghan to facilitate 
the control and eradication of avian influenza. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [592] 9
